title: Labour will order its MPs to back an attempt to force through second referendum
text:
Labour will this week back an attempt to force through a second referendum which would see Boris Johnson’s deal pitted against remaining in the European Union, Sir Keir Starmer has said.

The shadow Brexit secretary has revealed that the party will order its MPs to back changes to the Withdrawal Agreement Bill which would require the deal to be put to the public before the UK leaves the bloc.

Sir Keir also revealed that Labour would back proposals to keep the UK in a customs union with the EU and ensure close alignment with the bloc’s rules and regulations to reduce potential trade barriers after Brexit.
